Jack Sparrow.Action: Raises a tankard in salute to the hanging pirates.
Uses a leaking small fishing dory for travel, managing to steer it skillfully despite its condition.
Raises a tankard in salute to the pirates hanging on the gallows, showing boldness and wit.
Jumps from the rigging of his small leaking fishing dory to bail water with a tankard, demonstrating resourcefulness and adaptability.
Navigates the leaky Jolly Mon using a single sheet and the tiller to maneuver around the promontory.

Smoothly and with no wasted movement, hauls down the sail, stows it, guides the dory alongside the dock and quickly negotiates docking fees with the Harbormaster by offering coins without giving his real name.
Engages in witty banter with the Harbormaster demonstrating confidence and quick thinking.
Politely acknowledges sailors' authority and inquires conversationally about the ship and event.
Spreads his hands in apology and admits to admiring the ship.
Uses the alias 'Smith' and does not immediately reveal his true identity.
Confesses intention to do a little honest pirating, engaging candidly with others.
Suggests others wouldn't believe truth even if told, showing skepticism and mistrust.
Openly declares his plan to commandeer a ship and engage in honest pirating, showing confidence and clear intent.
Challenges Murtogg and Mullroy's skepticism by pointing out the paradox of truth-telling, demonstrating quick wit and clever reasoning.
Despite being annoyed and pushed aside, chooses to dive into the water to save Elizabeth, giving his pistol and sword belt to others to keep safe.
Dives into the water to save Elizabeth despite not being equipped and in a situation that annoys him; takes charge where others are unwilling or incapable.
Relies on others who cannot swim (Murtogg and Mullroy) but still delegates responsibility by giving them his pistol and belt, showing situational awareness and leadership.
Swims underwater to save Elizabeth, physically struggles but persists.
Removes Elizabeth's heavy velvet dress to aid in swimming to safety.
Realizes that Elizabeth's heavy velvet dress is weighing them down underwater, skillfully removes it to improve their chances of surfacing and swimming faster.
Struggles significantly to swim to the dock with Elizabeth, indicating difficulty in the rescue despite ultimately succeeding.
Slits Elizabeth's corset to help her breathe, showing quick thinking and concern for her wellbeing.
Hands knife back to Murtogg hilt-first, demonstrating consideration for others' safety.
Nods to Norrington with a blade at his throat, signaling cooperation under threat.
Holds the corset despite potential danger and suspicion, indicating protective behavior.
Responds politely with 'Captain Jack Sparrow. If you please.' despite being treated with suspicion.
Owns his shortcomings with a slight embarrassment when Norrington critiques his compass.
Stands calmly while half a dozen pistols are aimed at him without showing aggression or hostility.
Fails to provide a ship or proper equipment, which frustrates and disappoints others.
Snaps pistol away from opponent and takes Elizabeth as a human shield, holding her at manacle chain throat.
Acknowledges Elizabeth saving his life and claims they are 'square'.
Uses Elizabeth to negotiate with Norrington and demands his pistol and belt back.
Addresses everyone politely when escaping, including 'Gentleman... m'lady...'
Quickly disarms a pistol-wielding man by yanking the pistol into the water and uses Elizabeth as a shield while negotiating for his pistol and belt.
Calmly manipulates Elizabeth to put the belt on him, freeing himself from the manacles, then escapes confidently.
Shoves Elizabeth away to make his escape without regard for her safety.
Takes quick, daring actions to evade capture, showing focus on self-preservation rather than protection of others.
Protects himself cautiously by immediately drawing his sword upon Will’s unexpected intrusion, maintaining guardedness.
Shares a brief moment of recognition and unspoken connection by acknowledging Will with a tip of his head and a comment 'You look familiar...'.
Identifies the key details of the forge environment and acts cautiously to avoid waking the drunk smith.
Skillfully uses the glowing furnace to weaken and break the manacle chain despite physical pain and risk, freeing his hands.
Quickly reacts to the sound of the door latch by diving for cover, showing alertness and presence of mind.
Confronts Will calmly and confidently with sword drawn, using intimidation to keep Will at bay.
Shows some hesitation or confusion upon seeing Will, indicated by frown and the 'You look familiar' remark.
Engages in a respectful and playful fencing duel with Will, complimenting his skill.
Threatens Will by threatening Miss Swann and engages in a confrontational manner.
Smiles and maintains a teasing, good-natured tone even when trapped.
Jokes with Will about needing a girl and teases him lightly.
Engages in an intense, aggressive duel with Will, aiming to disarm and overpower him.
Uses sword and chain skillfully in duel despite being manacled; uses environment creatively (bellows sparks) to gain advantage.
Manages to disarm Will by swinging manacled chain but ends up with left arm suspended from ceiling, limiting one-handed fighting.
Maintains confidence and reacts quickly under pressure, aiming pistol at opponent at close range.
Smiles and admits to being a pirate after being accused of cheating.
Aims pistol at Will but backs down, indicating he is not intent on causing harm.
Demands Will move aside to let him escape, showing little regard for Will's feelings or position.
Aims pistol confidently to threaten Will, demands him to move, showing assertiveness and control in a tense standoff.
Uncocks pistol deliberately, indicating strategic thinking by not harming Will and assessing the situation.
Is unexpectedly hit on the head and captured, failing to anticipate the attack or avoid capture.
Coaxes the dog gently to come to him, trying to befriend it despite the situation.
Shows resignation and calm instead of anger or despair when left alone in the cell.
Pulls himself out from under rubble after explosion, tries to coax dog holding keys to freedom.
Fails to escape through breached wall as opening is too small, remains trapped alone.
Shows patience and calmness while coaxing dog, despite dangerous situation.
Warns mutineers and betrayers about the lowest circle of hell, showing a sense of justice and moral position.
Reacts with fury but does not escalate violence when grabbed by the throat, showing restraint.
Conveys the truth about the curse, attempts to warn others about danger (Koehler cursed), indicating concern for others.
Identifies that Koehler and Twigg are cursed by noticing Koehler's skeletal hand in the moonlight, demonstrating keen observation and knowledge of the supernatural curse.
Steps forward in anger and confronts mutineers with a strong statement about betrayal, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Does not laugh when others mock him or disparage his fortunes, maintaining composure amid provocation.
Locked in his cell after pirate attack, showing he was not allied with the invaders.
Mentioned in conversation but does not intervene or communicate during crisis.
Is locked in a cell, indicating he was captured and held prisoner by the invading pirates.
Talks about the Black Pearl in a way that is remembered by others, suggesting some insider knowledge or involvement.
Despite being locked in a cell and viewed as untrustworthy, he is considered relevant enough to be part of the discussion, implying he has some importance or competence in navigating pirate affairs.
Refuses to help Will rescue Elizabeth, saying there is no profit in it for him.
Remains relaxed and unconcerned while imprisoned, showing detachment rather than empathy.
Offers a bargain to Will Turner to be freed from the cell and promises loyalty to the Black Pearl in return.
Smiles and shakes hands with Will, showing goodwill to seal the agreement.
Insists on gathering his own belongings before escaping.
Asks Will about the girl and how far he is willing to go, showing interest and respect for Will's motivations.
Negotiates a deal with Will Turner to be freed from the cell in exchange for helping him get to the Black Pearl, showing confidence and strategic thinking.
Takes the time to gather his pistol, sword belt, and compass before leaving, showing awareness and preparation.
Questions Will about the girl’s significance and commitment, demonstrating insight and strategic assessment.
Takes command with confidence but ensures no harm will come to the sailors, offers them a boat to get back safely.
Points pistol at sailors through the sequence, maintaining control with threat of violence despite a friendly grin.
Takes control of the ship by surprising the crew and confidently brandishing pistols, demonstrating leadership in a difficult situation.
Maintains gunpoint on crew members while cleverly negotiating their cooperation and facilitating the raising of the anchor with limited help, showing situational awareness.
Uses humor and charm (grinning with laughing crew) to manage a tense situation, indicating social skill as part of his competence.
Underestimates the difficulty of lowering the anchor single-handedly, as seen when Will can’t turn it alone, but quickly improvises by enlisting reluctant help.
Successfully sails the Dauntless out of the harbor using limited means, demonstrating resourcefulness and practical skill.
Leans on the wheel relaxed while the ship is moving slowly, possibly implying overconfidence or under-engagement.
Silently climbs aboard enemy ship with Will, tackles sentry from behind and throws him overboard to prevent detection.
As the ship escapes, waves and sarcastically thanks Commodore Norrington.
Sneaks aboard enemy ship unnoticed, incapacitates sentry silently, and swiftly cuts grappling hooks to escape.
Throws sentry overboard after confirming he can swim, showing quick thinking and decisiveness.
Successfully escapes by raising sails and sailing away before enemy notices, demonstrating tactical skill and timing.
Sarcastically thanks the commodore aloud, possibly alerting the enemy and mocking them, which could be risky but demonstrates confidence.
Disables the rudder chain of the Dauntless, causing it to lose steering and fall behind.
Takes physical slaps from women around Tortuga without retaliation or anger, even makes a joke about borrowing a boat without permission.
Leaves Will to handle uncomfortable situations (ignores redheaded woman’s slap, backs away from Anamaria).
Reassures Anamaria she will get her livelihood boat back or a better one.
Engages in a friendly, familiar banter with Gibbs despite Gibbs being drunk and cantankerous.
Helps Gibbs to his feet after splashing him with water.
Confidently assures AnaMaria her livelihood will be restored or improved despite conflict.
Uses social skills and knowledge of contacts (Gibbs) to pursue information and plans.
Calmly handles awkward social situations (being slapped) without losing composure.
Engages Gibbs with a clever counter to bad luck superstition, showing wit and social savvy.
Engages Gibbs in a secretive but collaborative discussion about recruiting a crew for a dangerous mission.
Smiles enigmatically and hints at possessing something valuable to Barbossa, showing confidence but withholding full sincerity.
Shows trust and reliance on Will Turner by having him guard the door, indicating loyalty and respect toward his allies.
Nods to Anamaria acknowledging debt without fuss.
Selecting crew members despite obvious drawbacks, showing tolerance for flaws.
Grimaces at Cotton's mutilation but proceeds to engage with him and his parrot.
Carefully inspects and evaluates the group of sailors before choosing crew members, showing discernment and awareness.
Acknowledges AnaMaria's presence and debt to him, showing awareness of his obligations and previous interactions.
Not clearly decisive about the crew choices, showing dissatisfaction with some candidates.
Acknowledges danger openly to potential crew, sets a high-risk mission, and retains only those willing to face it.
Does not react with anger or coercion when crew members back away in fright, but accepts the loss rather than forcing loyalty.
Commands and insists on keeping sail despite warnings about danger from crew member Gibbs.
Enjoys the moment with Gibbs, sharing his positive mood by shouting 'We're catching up!'
Leans over and studies his compass intently, showing focus and trust in his own judgment.
Promised each crew member an equal share and gave up the location of the island to maintain fairness.
Plays things close to the vest after learning from past experience, indicating guardedness.
Gives precise and confident orders to change the ship's course based on the compass reading.
Possesses a unique compass that does not point north but provides bearings to a secret location.
Although an honest streak is noted, he shares the bearing of the secret island with the crew, leading to a mutiny.
Gives himself up for the sake of his loyal crewmen, accepting marooning.
Teases Will and Gibbs with the ghost story, laughs.
Refuses to tell the full story of his escape, calling it a dark and unpleasant tale.
Shows cold pragmatism by implying he considered using his pistol on his mutinous first mate Barbossa.
Explains sailing strategy clearly and confidently to AnaMaria, demonstrating knowledge of nautical terms and tactics.
Explains the cave and waterfall situation to Will with a mix of humor and caution.
Leads the small group safely into the underwater lagoon despite the danger.
Navigates a small boat into a dangerous cave mouth at water level using his knowledge of tide stories and natural features, successfully entering the underwater lagoon.
Responds to Will's questions with measured uncertainty but uses available information to make decisions in uncertain circumstances.
Does not intervene or show concern as Barbossa shoots Jacoby to test the curse.
Observes the cursed treasure situation along with the others, shows cautious behavior but does not take direct action.
Catches Elizabeth before she can attack and claims he is rescuing her, clarifying his intentions.
Volunteers to stay behind and fight pursuing pirates to give Will and Elizabeth a chance to escape, insisting on leading enemies away.
Quickly decides to stay behind and lead the pursuing pirates away, allowing Will and Elizabeth to escape and signal the ship.
Calmly stops the group at a critical moment to assess that continuing together would not work, showing awareness of the situation.
Accepts a dangerous debt to balance the scales, showing a sense of honor and responsibility.
Allows Will and Elizabeth to leave safely with a quick kiss from Elizabeth, showing a moment of genuine connection.
Uses the right of parlay to avoid unnecessary fighting, demonstrating diplomacy and restraint.
Smiles confidently and negotiates with hostile pirates, showing calm and friendly demeanor despite danger.
Leads a tense negotiation by invoking the 'right of parlay' confidently and skillfully, manipulating Barbossa and pirates by knowing vital information about their curse.
Maintains a calm, confident demeanor (smiling) when threatened with death, showing psychological composure and cleverness.
Claims to be a man of his word and offers a deal based solely on his promise.
Acknowledges his 'honest streak' as a kind of curse, showing a form of self-awareness and sincerity.
Responds to threats with a calm and almost humorous attitude, smiling smugly despite danger.
Expresses trust in Barbossa despite knowing the latter's hostility and distrust.
Proposes a risky plan involving deception but also truth to protect himself and bargain.
Confidently negotiates with Barbossa by offering only a name in exchange for the Black Pearl, relying on his wit and understanding of Barbossa's motivations.
Uses psychological insight to turn the negotiation in his favor, implying Barbossa must trust him because otherwise Barbossa remains cursed and vulnerable.
Maintains a calm, smug demeanor even when threatened, demonstrating control over the situation despite being at an apparent disadvantage.
Refuses to flinch or give concessions under threat of imprisonment or torture, indicating strong resolve and strategic patience.
Nods calmly to Barbossa's threat and insult, staying composed in the face of mistrust and confinement.
Plays close to the edge, showing calculated risk-taking acknowledged by Barbossa.
Caught off guard and surprised to learn Barbossa does not have the medallion.
Shows awareness of the battle situation from the brig and attempts to verbally influence Twigg, indicating a strategic mindset even while imprisoned.
Warns Will not to do anything stupid or say anything stupid, showing concern for Will's safety.
Stands manacled beside Barbossa and does not intervene to stop the pirates from mistreating Elizabeth or Will.
Stands manacled beside Barbossa, unable to immediately influence the situation, and internally urges Will not to do anything stupid or say anything foolish.
Is appointed governor of an island by Barbossa, suggesting some prior trust or respect.
Points out the unfairness of making a Captain walk the plank twice on his own ship.
Jokes with Barbossa about being a gentleman and shooting the lady first.
Relies on pirates' adherence to the code regarding the pistol.
Comments wittily on the unfairness of being forced to walk the plank twice, demonstrating awareness and humor in a dire situation.
Recalls that last time he was forced to walk the plank, he was left a pistol with one shot, exhibiting his attentive memory and strategic thinking.
Attempts to negotiate for two pistols, showing confidence and strategic negotiation skills.
Is restrained and forced into a perilous situation (walking the plank) which indicates a lack of control over circumstances, but this is imposed by others rather than due to personal failure.
Swims back down into the depths after being freed instead of heading for safety.
Shows resourcefulness by retrieving his pistol under dangerous conditions.
Swims after Elizabeth instead of leaving her behind.
Reassembles pistol but refrains from using it immediately, showing restraint.
Admits openly that their situation is hopeless and expresses discouragement.
Acknowledges grim situation realistically but remains calm and pragmatic to encourage hope.
Toasts Elizabeth and Will to give some comfort and solidarity despite the dire situation.
Shares rum with Elizabeth, invites her to join in a small ritual to relieve stress.
Displays some defiance and bitterness but admits to not being happy about circumstances, showing some sincerity.
Drinks alone and then turns away, avoiding emotional engagement.
Jokes or teases Elizabeth with informal address after she asks to be called Miss Swann, displaying playful camaraderie.
Barters passage off the island previously, showing resourcefulness.
Assesses current situation pragmatically, noting the rumrunners are out of business and that rescue requires watching for passing ships.
Plans to survive for a month or more on island resources and keep a lookout for rescue, showing practical survival skills.
Acknowledges limitations and doesn't waste energy on despair, choosing to remain calm and realistic.
Drinks alcohol excessively while stranded, which may impair judgment and action.
Engages Elizabeth in drinking to cope with situation, potentially evading active solution.
Encourages Elizabeth to share a pirate song from her childhood and joins in drinking with her to hear it.
Encourages Elizabeth to share her pirate song and engages playfully with her, showing social confidence and leadership.
Enthusiastically insists on more drinks to ease Elizabeth into singing, demonstrating persuasive and confident social skills.
Passively accepts a childish or silly pirate song without critique, indicating lack of critical judgment or seriousness in this context.
Drains the bottle confidently, expresses vision about reclaiming the Black Pearl and teaching the crew a song, talks philosophically about what a ship really means.
Is roaring drunk and settles shakily to the ground, showing lack of physical control.
Maintains confident and charismatic speech despite drunkenness, inspiring Elizabeth with his ideas about freedom and the ship.
Shares a drink and a toast with Elizabeth in a friendly, congenial manner.
Expresses disbelief and concern when Elizabeth burns the food, shade, and rum on the island.
Reacting with disbelief and confusion to Elizabeth burning their supplies and island resources.
Immediately wakes up and assesses the situation upon noticing smoke and fire on the island.
Admits Elizabeth is right, acknowledging their prior acquaintance and potential usefulness.
Shakes his head at Elizabeth's resolve and comments on difficulties with her, showing frustration rather than warmth.
Immediately recognizes the approaching H.M.S. Dauntless and assesses the situation with disbelief.
Admits Elizabeth is right about his knowledge of Isla de Muerta, showing awareness of his capabilities and limitations.
Speechless and frustrated by Elizabeth's determined stance, momentarily lost composure.
Attempts to convince Norrington of the pirate threat, demonstrating strategic thinking and awareness of greater stakes.
Proposes to face the enemy alone to protect others and minimize risk to crew.
Expresses resentment toward pirates who left him stranded but uses it to motivate a potentially self-sacrificial plan.
Watches Elizabeth being escorted away with amusement rather than concern.
States he has a plan that will make the battle brief and one-sided, shows confidence and strategic thinking.
Volunteers to go alone to trick the pirates into an ambush, demonstrating initiative and bold tactical decision.
Displays good understanding of tactical disadvantages of enemy (caves with ambush risk), showing situational awareness.
Expresses amusement as Elizabeth is escorted away, possibly indicating detachment or distraction.
Offers to sneak in and talk the pirates into coming out to allow others to blow them away, showing willingness to use cunning to help comrades.
Wraps his pistol securely in an oilskin pouch before action, indicating careful preparation.
Draws up a chart to help the crew navigate past reefs, showing foresight and planning.
Plans to slip in and talk the enemies out, allowing comrades to attack, demonstrating strategic thinking and confidence.
Leads Will carefully through caves, warns him to stay quiet to avoid detection.
Does not fight when captured with Will by Barbossa and pirates.
Leads Will through confusing caves confident of the path.
Does not resist or fight when captured by Barbossa and his men.
Silently leads pirates directly to their trap, betraying trust.
Warns Barbossa about the incoming attack to prevent Will's immediate death.
Suggests delaying the killing to ensure survival advantage, showing strategic concern.
Leads Barbossa and the pirates directly to their location, indicating premeditation and control of the situation.
Remains silent when accused by Will, showing confidence and composure under pressure.
Convinces Barbossa not to kill Will by informing about the H.M.S. Dauntless lying in wait, demonstrating strategic thinking and knowledge.
Shakes off those holding him and confidently approaches the situation, showing physical assertiveness and self-assurance.
Scoop and drops coins back into the chest while negotiating, indicating calmness and control even while captive.
Proposes an alliance to Barbossa, offering a share of plunder and a position of prestige, showing cooperative and diplomatic behavior.
Smiles and spreads hands while proposing the deal, indicating friendliness and openness.
Shows hesitation and falters when Barbossa gives unexpected orders, indicating vulnerability and sincerity in the interaction.
Slips a sword to Will to help him fight pirates.
Quickly disarms a pirate by slipping a sword from his scabbard and tosses it to Will, enabling him to fight back.
Engages multiple opponents using a mix of swordsmanship, fists, acrobatics, and improvised tactics to survive.
Pretends to be less clever than he actually is, deflecting suspicion.
Makes a witty remark to Barbossa, maintaining composure in face of danger.
Steals a coin from the Aztec gold despite knowing it is cursed.
Attempts to negotiate with Barbossa by suggesting surrender.
Kills Barbossa decisively to end the threat
Joins Will by the chest, openly admits to being the worst pirate, acknowledges trustworthiness with a hint of irony
Cuts his palm to grip the coin but hesitates and releases the coin instead of taking it
Admits he can’t pass up revenge and knows how to get what he wants, describing himself as a great pirate
Puts a hand on Norrington's shoulder and says 'Tough luck. I was rooting for you.'
Knows his own motivations clearly and deliberates over using the coin he stole, but then chooses to release it instead, showing self-control and situational awareness.
Makes a calculated, symbolic gesture with the coin that triggers a reaction (chest slamming shut), indicating insight into mystical or situational details.
Puts a hand on Norrington's shoulder and delivers a witty remark, showing social confidence and ability to read group dynamics.
Escapes prison and frees his crew during a high-stakes moment.
Escapes prison without damage to the cell, indicating careful planning and skillful execution of the break-out.
Appears swinging from the gallows onto the ship’s rigging during escape, showing confidence and agility.
Commands crew with polite and appreciative language, promotes teamwork by assigning cleaning tasks.
Expresses joy and affection toward his ship, shows pride and positive attitude without arrogance.
Takes command of the Black Pearl confidently, gives clear and effective orders to crew members, and shows familiarity with the ship’s handling.
Expresses joy and comfort in his role as captain, indicating confidence and emotional alignment with his responsibilities.
